meanings.definition: A device for injecting fuel into an engine.
meanings.sent1: The injectors in the car engine ensure the right amount of fuel is delivered.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic checked the injectors to make sure the engine was running smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The injectors in the engine were like tiny chefs carefully adding fuel to the mix.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like injectors, fueling his determination to succeed.
meanings.sent5: The injectors hummed as they worked, a symphony of precision in the engine.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that injects something.
meanings.sent1: The nurse was the main injector of hope and comfort for the patients.
meanings.sent2: The injector of new ideas sparked creativity in the team.
meanings.sent3: The birthday clown was the injector of laughter at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an injector of joy, spreading happiness to all around her.
meanings.sent5: The sun acted as an injector of warmth, embracing everything in its light.

meanings.definition: A medical device used to administer medication or fluids into the body.
meanings.sent1: The doctor used the injectors to deliver the vaccine painlessly.
meanings.sent2: The nurse prepared the injectors with precision before the procedure.
meanings.sent3: The injectors in the hospital were like tiny superheroes saving lives.
meanings.sent4: Her touch was gentle, like an injector of calmness in a stressful situation.
meanings.sent5: The injectors hissed softly as they released the medication, bringing relief to the patient.
